729588f-a.text:
St. Marks Place, west side, between Fort Place and Wall Street, showing the McKee Vocational High School. The view is
north from Fort Place.
June 22, B)SP
P. L. Sperr

Gift of Albert Norman

729583f-b.text:
(1)
326 St. Marks Place, east side, at the head of Fort Place, showing the "Bella Vista,' built in the Norman-French style of architecture. The chateau was owned by Mrs. J. C. Thompson, in 1874; by Fred Tiedmann, in 1898; and by Richard
Agar, in 1907.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view, seen from Nyatt Street.
May 28, 1927
P. L. Sperr
2SO E S
Nea 2 E947

302 St. Marks Plaoe, adjoining the N.W. corner of Fort Place, showing the Staten Island Masonic Club. The house was owned by the Carrere family from 1898 to
